pros:
-Working with students and helping them better their English since I would be working with ESL( English as a second language).
- Learning new skills that'll help me after the job to become a more talkative and social person and not fearing on trying out new things.
cons: No cons from this experience enjoyed every single second,

review_title: Easy job but poor upper managenent
cons: Upper management dont care about you

pros:
Be able to make strong relationships with community
Rewarding Job
cons: Hours are long and turnover rate is high

review_title: Fine for first job but expect Nepotism if you want to move up.
pros: Helping kids and providing positive experiences. If part time afternoon hours help if you goto school.
cons: They do not hire outside talent. Everyone who has held a higher position is related one way or another to someone else that’s holding a higher job title. Asked to fake student signatures for funding.

job_title: Youth Counselor in San Diego, CA
pros: Flexible Hours. Good pay. Great at communication. Very rewarding work
cons: Working with kids is not always easy.

pros:
You gain real experience working with students. You help them with homework as well as do fun activities like play sports or do art. It's definitely an eye opener to whether or not you want to have a career in education and overall work with youth. It's corny, but when students succeed or thank you for helping them, you feel great about it. 

Also, the school is wonderful. If you work at a really good school, you learn a lot and make connections. You will gain support from the teachers and staff you interact with.
cons:
At first, it’s great, but you'll learn very quickly how messed up this place is. If you’re looking to just clock in and get your check, that’s fine. 

Warning though -- it’s frustrating to work here if you are passionate. Supervisors know who they like and will treat them much better. Give them the more well behaved students, give them the enrichments they want to teach, even give them more hours to work. Actually, you’ll start to question are working at a middle school or going to middle school? Mentors will start gossiping with each other about their co-workers. Supervisors will also start gossiping to students! Very unprofessional.

review_title: I worked at EBAYC as an Academic Mentor
pros: Good place to gain experience working with youth
cons: Work can sometimes be stressful depending on the grade you're teaching
Unless you’re related or socially connected with upper management you will go no where fast.

pros: You get a great opportunity to work with the youth in the community. The mentors in this organization are invested and committed. They are great people who definitely show that they care.
cons: No real downsides as long as you know what the organization does. Sometimes you might feel like there isn't much of a point in what you do, but you have to remember that you are probably helping someone.

job_title: Student Mentor in Castro Valley, CA
pros: The work environment is very friendly, fun and supportive. The director of the after school program does not view himself as someone who has authority over his staff. Teamwork is a huge part for the program, everyone communicates well and always strives to become better. The experience is great for individuals that want to build their career in youth related work. Overall, the experience of this job is very rewarding as you see youth progresses.
cons: Mostly part-time and very little full-time position are available.

pros: Working with students after school allowed me to be a teacher and a mentor. While I developed great teaching experience, I also learned how to effectively build rapport with the a diverse group of students and this really helped me in my later endeavors in community organizing and outreach.
cons: The program was great and being one of the students that grew up using EBAYC services I was surprised to hear that they are now charging students to attend their program.

pros: I think it is a good job for a stepping stone into the education field, especially working with students. It is a good position to help you manage your time, work, and creating lesson plans for students.
cons: The job can require more of your time than needed sometimes. The program is aligned with the OUSD calendar and usually have to adapt to the school schedule if there is any changes like breaks, school events.

review_title: Great organization aimed towards helping youth!
pros: Great environment and amazing staff! Dedicated to improving the community and helping students!
cons: The location can be a bit loud and dangerous. It is right by Bart and the freeway so it can be a bit noisy.

pros: great environment and motivating management. People there are fantastic, and the contact with high school kids makes it even better
cons: low pay salary and hard to get full-time positions. The program budget is not permanent, so must likely it will fluctuate, and you may end up unemployed.

pros: What EBAYC is doing to be a change agent in our community in Oakland is amazing.
cons: It is a non profit and funding is hard to maintain. We need more support.

pros: Great company to work for! Very down to earth coworkers, you can tell a lot of people have a passion for their job
cons: More transparency among workers and directors would be nice

pros: Great opportunity to work with middle school students.
